West Ham increase offer for Felipe Anderson while Lazio monitor Gelson Martins's situation

West Ham continue their pursuit of Lazio's Felipe Anderson. The Hammers have submitted an offer close to €40 million including easily reachable bonuses, that would be triggered at the third and fifth appearance of the Brazilian with the Premier League club. Lazio's president Lotito asked for €50 million, but he could also settle for a sum just above the 40 million mark. Talks between clubs will continue in the coming days.

The Biancocelesti are already working on finding a possible replacement for the Brazilian and one of the candidates could be Portugues winger Gelson Martins, born in 1995. The Sporting CP player's situation is quite complicated as he expects Lazio to pay the possible costs deriving from the loss of the lawsuit against his current club.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/west-ham-increase-offer-for-felipe-anderson-while-lazio-eye-gelson-martins-as-possible-replacement

Juventus and Genoa close to an agreement for Alberto Cerri


A new deal might be closed between Juventus and Genoa after the one that brought Perin to Turin. The two clubs have actually met to talk about Alberto Cerri's future, born in 96' forward, owned by the Bianconeri and who played for Perugia last season.

The striker is in fact close from becoming a new Genoa player, with a deal that could be reached for around €15m.

Chelsea transfer targets: The names on Blues' wishlist as Marina Granovskaia works on several deals

Chelsea director Marina Granovskaia is believed to be currently working on securing a number of transfer targets.

The Blues have yet to make any purchases in the window, though a £35million offer for Juventus defender Daniele Rugani has been made.

Others on their wish-list include Jamaal Lascelles, Leon Bailey, Anthony Martial and Jean Michael Seri. If Sarri is eventually appointed as expected, he will also ask Chelsea to pursue a number of his former players at Napoli.

Chelsea could also be in the market for another striker amid reports that Alvaro Morata’s agent is meeting with club officials next week to confirm the Spain international wants to leave.

Standard Sport revealed last month that Morata’s former club Juventus, where he played between 2014-16, had offered Gonzalo Higuain in exchange.

【now.com體育】阿仙奴於官網宣布，新一季波衫的10號主人將會是奧斯爾。

德國中場奧斯爾（Mesut Ozil）自2013年加盟阿仙奴後，一直都穿上11號波衫，對於今次轉為傳統進攻中場的代號「10號仔」，他便說：「這個號碼對我來說是十分特別，這亦非什麼秘密。我的童年偶像施丹便是穿着這個號碼，它仍然是中場組織球員最有代表性的號碼。我很期待夏天休息後，首次為阿仙奴穿上10號波衫！」奧斯爾於今年一月才和阿仙奴續約至2021年，周薪為35萬鎊。

阿仙奴對上一名10號球衣的主人便是英格蘭中場韋舒亞，作為球隊青訓他於2012年接過離隊的荷蘭射手尹佩斯繼承了10號，當時他只是20歲。雖然這幾年內他曾經外借到般尼茅夫，惟阿仙奴一直都保留10號，直至今個夏天韋舒亞宣布離隊轉投費倫巴治。

Jugones report Real Madrid have accepted Juve bid for Cristiano

According to the director of the daily sports show Josep Pedrerol, the Portuguese striker is set for a move to Turin set to earn a sum of 30 million euro per year.

According to Spanish daily sports programme Jugones, Real Madrid have decided to sell Cristiano Ronaldo to Juventus. Presenter of the show Josep Pedrerol affirmed that the LaLiga club are set to accept a 100 million euro offer from the Serie A side for the striker they purchased from Manchester United for a fee of 96 million in 2009.

According to Jugones the Madeira born striker will earn a similar salary as he does with the Santiago Bernabeu outfit but the decision to move to the Italian league is fueled by the desire the Portuguese striker has for a new environment and fresh challenge.

Jugones report that the now 33-year-old player deems his cycle in Madrid to have come to an end and indeed was acutely aware of the interest from the Old Lady of Italian football before the 2017/18 Kiev Champions League final. The striker now hopes that Real Madrid won't stand in his way of a move to Italy and according to Jugones, Real Madrid appear prepared to go along with the move which will see Cristiano wear the famous black and white striped shirt next season in Serie A.

https://en.as.com/en/2018/07/03/football/1530626414_296295.html

Everton to hold transfer summit - Silva, Brands and Kenwright all present

Everton will hold a transfer summit tonight as they look to consolidate plans for the window.

Blues manager Marco Silva and director of football Marcel Brands have headed to London for a meeting with chairman Bill Kenwright.

Everton are trying to trim their bloated squad and have so far focused on moving players out of the club with Joel Robles, Ramiro Funes Mori and Wayne Rooney all allowed to leave.

Silva and Brands are determined to to start the new season with a group of 25 players and with a smaller wage bill.

But the Blues have also been lining transfer targets and will this evening discuss their next steps in the window.

In the 2017-18 season, Inglese scored 12 Serie A goals in 34 games, also providing two assists.

Cristiano Ronaldo: Real Madrid now want 150m - La Stampa

The Turin-based daily says Florentino Pérez is unhappy with the way Cristiano and his agent, Jorge Mendes, have handled his mooted move.

The completion of Cristiano Ronaldo's move from Real Madrid to Juventus is seemingly only a matter of time.

Real Madrid chief now wants 150m for Cristiano, says La Stampa

However, a not insignificant stumbling block will reportedly have to be overcome first: the Italian newspaper La Stampa has revealed that Real president Florentino Pérez now wants 150 million euros for the Portuguese striker.

The Turin-based daily says that Pérez is unhappy with Cristiano and his agent, Jorge Mendes, over the way they have handled his mooted departure from the Bernabéu, and is now determined not to let the 33-year-old leave for the 100-million-euro fee that had been expected to persuade him to sell.

Pérez "won't be negotiated down to less than 130m"
"He [Pérez] is asking for 150m and, according to sources close to him, won't be negotiated down to less than 130m," claims La Stampa's report.

l Real Madrid C. F. comunica que, atendiendo a la voluntad y petición expresadas por el jugador Cristiano Ronaldo, ha acordado su traspaso a la Juventus F. C.

Hoy el Real Madrid quiere expresar su agradecimiento a un jugador que ha demostrado ser el mejor del mundo y que ha marcado una de las épocas más brillantes de la historia de nuestro club y del fútbol mundial.

Más allá de los títulos conquistados, de los trofeos conseguidos y de los triunfos alcanzados en los terrenos de juego durante estos 9 años, Cristiano Ronaldo ha sido un ejemplo de entrega, de trabajo, de responsabilidad, de talento y de superación.

Se ha convertido además en el máximo goleador de la historia del Real Madrid con 451 goles en 438 partidos. En total 16 títulos, entre ellos 4 Copas de Europa, 3 de ellas consecutivas y 4 en las últimas 5 temporadas. A título individual, con la camiseta del Real Madrid ha ganado 4 Balones de Oro, 2 The Best, y 3 Botas de Oro, entre otros muchos galardones.

Para el Real Madrid Cristiano Ronaldo será siempre uno de sus grandes símbolos y una referencia única para las próximas generaciones.

El Real Madrid será siempre su casa.
